org.formix.btb

Class Bridge<A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.formix.btb.Bridge<A>

  • public class Bridge<A>
extends Object

    Defines a data bridge that is responsible for object persistence to a database. This object relational mapper is optimised to work with POJOs respecting these behaviors:

    1. The class must provide a public default (parameterless) constructor (but you can define any constructor you wish thereafter).
    2. The class must provide both read and write methods for each of its properties (but they don't have to be public).

    When an object is passed to any of the Bridge's insert, update, delete of fill method, the object is assumed to be a persistable entity. The name of the class is assumed to be the name of a table and the object's properties are assumed to be the table's columns.

    Note for case sensitive RDBMS
    Do not forget to match the capitalization from your class names to your table names. Further more properties are camelcased. For example, take the hypotetic property "first name" (getFirstName() and setFirstName() methods). This property is assumed to match the column name "firstName".

    Author:
    Jean-Philippe Gravel

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bridge

        public Bridge(Class<A> type,
              String... ignoredProperties)
       throws SQLException
        Creates a new Bridge using the default connection string as defined in the "bridge.xml" file. See net.sf.btb.ConnectionManager for more informations about this file.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the class to be bridged.
        ignoredProperties - Optional array of strings telling the name of ignored properties for the given class A. Those properties will not be saved or loaded from database.
        Throws:
        SQLException - Thrown when a problem occurs during SQL execution.
        See Also:
        ConnectionManager

      • Bridge

        public Bridge(Connection connection,
              Class<A> type,
              String... ignoredProperties)
       throws SQLException
        Creates a new Bridge using the default connection string as defined in the "bridge.xml" file. See net.sf.btb.ConnectionManager for more informations about this file.
        Parameters:
        connection - The connection to the database.
        type - The type of the class to be bridged.
        ignoredProperties - Optional array of strings telling the name of ignored properties for the given class A. Those properties will not be saved or loaded from database.
        Throws:
        SQLException - Thrown when a problem occurs during SQL execution.
        See Also:
        ConnectionManager

      • setConnection

        public void setConnection(Connection connection)
        Deprecated. This method does nothing anymore. The bridge connection cannot be changed at runtime. «Use the singleton instance from the Connector class or pass a connection object to the bridge constructor.
        Sets the current connection. If the bridge should use the default connection, set it to null.
        Parameters:
        connection - The connection to use to get data.

      • newQuery

        public <I extends A> Query<I> newQuery(Class<I> desiredType)
        Create a query to select object of the current generic type into a derived class type.
        Type Parameters:
        I - The type of the returned objects from the query. This type must implement the base type A.
        Parameters:
        desiredType - The derived class type to be used by the created query.
        Returns:
        a Query object that will generate objects from the specified desired type.
